reviews.review_text: Not as good as his other books but still worth reading.  I love his writing style and his subject matter so I can forgive some of the faults.  Jitterbug Perfume is the best as far as I am concerned.
Fun read with pearls of philosophy and social commentary. In true style,  it will take you on a journey out of this world
Bought it for my wife who is a huge Tom Robbins fan. She likes it, so I am happy.

Tour de Force! Start Take Tom Robbins best book and combine with a brilliantly nuanced reading by Barry Bostwick and you end up with one of the best audio books ever made. Robbins allusions never cease to amaze, and they're virtually non-stop, which makes listening to it over and over again a real pleasure. I've heard it at least a dozen times and each time I find new gems. His flirtations with history and mythology are fascinating. If you like Robbins, you'll like this audio book. 9, 90-minute cassette tapes! That's a lot of unabridged, in-your-face Robbins.
A little too clever for me
I'm a HUGE Tom Robbins fan. This is a classic...

title: Half Asleep in Frog Pajamas
word_cloud: not good still read love write style subject matter forgive fault best far concern classic wonderful perfect pearl philosophy social commentary true style journey world wife huge fan like happy best combine brilliantly nuanced read end best audio ever make allusion never cease amaze virtually make listen real pleasure hear least dozen time time find new gem flirtation history mythology fascinate like audio cassette tape lot unabridged robbins story excellent write little clever huge fan classic great
summary:
When the stock market crashes on the Thursday before Easter, you—an ambitious, although ineffectual and not entirely ethical young broker—are convinced that you’re facing the Weekend from Hell. 

Before the market reopens on Monday, you’re going to have to scramble and scheme to cover your butt, but there’s no way you can anticipate the baffling disappearance of a 300-pound psychic, the fall from grace of a born-again monkey, or the intrusion in your life of a tattooed stranger intent on blowing your mind and most of your fuses. 

Over these fateful three days, you will be forced to confront everything from mysterious African rituals to legendary amphibians, from tarot-card bombshells to street violence, from your own sexuality to outer space. This is, after all, a Tom Robbins novel—and the author has never been in finer form.
story_arc:
An initial rise in good fortunes, followed
                    by a setback, but a happy ending
